awd_titl_txt: Study of Flux-flow Dynamics in High-Tc Materials
awd_abstract_narration: This project is an investigation of the dynamics of flux-flow in                high-Tc superconducting materials which are of technological and                fundamental interest.  Several methods will be employed to study                the behavior of flux-flow.  The primary method is the use of a                  SQUID magnetometer to measure directly the flux-line movement,                  which signals the onset of flux-flow.  By studying the behavior of              flux-flow, information about pinning centers and the static                     structure of the flux lattice can be obtained.  In addition, the                characteristics of flux-flow noise, important for device                        applications, will be investigated.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
